cut in.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to interrupt someone who is speaking by saying something
cut in.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: ‘What shall I do?’ Patrick cut in again.
Sorry to cut in on you, but there are one or two things I don’t understand.
cut in.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to suddenly drive in front of a moving car in a dangerous way
cut in.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: She cut in on a red Ford, forcing the driver to brake heavily.
cut in.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if a part of a machine cuts in, it starts to operate when it is needed
cut in.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The safety device cuts in automatically.
cut in.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to allow someone to take part in a plan or to make money from it
cut in.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Come on, Joey, you promised to cut me in on this one!
